name: 2.12 "Where There's a Will" Online Quiz | 'Cheers'- Season 2 | 10 Questions

questions.text: What news did the man at the bar have?
questions.correct: He had six months to live.
options: He was about to become a grandfather.
He had three months to live.
questions.explanation:
He had six months to live.

	He seemed rather down when Diane was waiting on him. She made a few jokes to try to cheer him up and he told her he only had six months to live.

questions.text: What didn't Coach know the meaning of?
questions.explanation:
threshold.

	Someone commented that Coach has a high threshold for pain. Coach replied, "I don't know the meaning of the word." The person thinks that Coach was referring to pain and Norm then stated, "He doesn't know what threshold means."

questions.text: What was the name of the man who visited the bar?
questions.explanation:
Malcolm Krammer.

	Malcolm Krammer was played by George Gaynes. Gaynes is probably best known for playing Henry Warnimont on "Punky Brewster". He was born in 1917 in Finland.

questions.text: Where did the man in the bar attend college?
questions.explanation:
Harvard.

	Malcolm told Sam that he worked his way through Harvard Business School as a bartender. Sam let him tend bar at Cheers for a bit.

questions.text: What did Diane call the guys at the bar?
questions.explanation:
maggots.

	Diane gave the people at Cheers a speech about how great they were to Malcolm. She said there was nothing she wouldn't do for them and some of the men told her to get dressed down to her skivvies.

questions.text: How much money did the man leave to the people at Cheers?
questions.explanation:
$100,000.

	The will at first was not valid according to the lawyer at Cheers. They found Malcolm again to make the will valid.

questions.text: How did Norm say he and the man hugged?
questions.explanation:
with their eyes.

	The bar was deciding who to send to get Malcolm. Everyone was fighting over it for fear that the person would try to sway Malcolm into giving them more money than the others.

questions.text: What did Norm call the man who left them money?
questions.explanation:
Mervin.

	Malcolm said he didn't have any close relatives and Norm replied, "Now you do, Mervin." The man said his name was Malcolm. Norm replied, "Can I call you Mervin, it was my father's name."

questions.text: What did Sam do with the will?
questions.explanation:
burned it.

	Everyone was fighting over the money. Sam told them they would all get an equal share. They continued to fight so Sam burned the will. Only Sam didn't burn the real will, he palmed that and burned a fake one.

questions.text: How low did Diane say Sam sunk?
questions.correct: He'd need a ladder to kiss a snake's hiney.
options: He'd need a ladder to reach the ground.
He'd need a ladder to touch the grass.
He'd need a ladder to see over the guard rail.
questions.explanation:
He'd need a ladder to kiss a snake's hiney.

	Sam eventually burned the real will. He at first burned another fake one but Diane told him anyone who did that would be eaten away by guilt for the rest of their life. After she left Sam said, "I hate her. I really really do. I hate her so much," and destroyed the real will.
